page.title: 09Trade(1) in Leverton
page.content: Traditionally this is a farming village with many of the population working on farms or in farming related occupations.We have a village shop,a garage and a builder who also employ local people.The village shop,Main Road Stores,sells a variety of goods that village people need.It sells food,drink(both alcoholic and non-alcoholic),magazines and has a library of films on video for people to borrow at a nominal fee.The shop also serves a passing trade of motorists who stop for sweets and ice-cream,newspapers,tobacco etc on their way through the village.It opens at 6.30 in the morning for the lorry-drivers and closes at 9.30 in the evening seven days a week.It is a family business and also runs a delivery service for those who cannot get to the shop.
